image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: (Cousin of Edgar Dean Crumpacker and Maurice Edgar Crumpacker), a Representative from Indiana; born in South Bend, St. Joseph County, Ind., February 13, 1917; attended the public schools; was graduated from Northwestern University, Evanston, Ill., in 1938, and from the law school of the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor in 1941; was admitted to the bar the same year and commenced the practice of law in South Bend, Ind.; entered the United States Army Air Corps as a private September 26, 1941, and advanced through the ranks to flight chief in a fighter squadron; commissioned a lieutenant in 1943 and assigned to heavy-bomber maintenance; relieved from active duty as a first lieutenant March 1, 1946; major in the Air Force Reserve; owned and operated a farm; delegate to Indiana State Republican convention 1958 through 1970; elected as a Republican to the Eighty-second, Eighty-third, and Eighty-fourth Congresses (January 3, 1951-January 3, 1957); did not seek renomination in 1956; practiced law until 1977; appointed judge of the St. Joseph Superior Court and served from 1977-1985; was a resident of South Bend, Ind., until his death there October 14, 1986; interment in Riverview Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1940-1956, 7 boxes.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Shepard J. Crumpacker, Jr. contain his congressional papers (1951-1956), including correspondence, reports, and legislation, relating to the automobile industry and a federal investigation of industry monopolistic practices, electoral college reform, patent law reform, defense procurement practices, international copyright law, UNESCO, air defense policy, trade restrictions to protect the American tuna industry, matters before the House Judiciary Committee, and local issues; together with papers relating to Crumpacker's 1954 election campaign, Republican National Committee correspondence (1953-1954), newsletters, speeches, and appointments. A finding aid is available in the repository.
